title: Beyond Unbounded Beliefs: How Preferences and Information Interplay in Social Learning. (arXiv:2103.02754v4 [econ.TH] UPDATED)
abstract: When does society eventually learn the truth, or take the correct action, via observational learning? In a general model of sequential learning over social networks, we identify a simple condition for learning dubbed excludability. Excludability is a joint property of agents' preferences and their information. When required to hold for all preferences, it is equivalent to information having "unbounded beliefs", which demands that any agent can individually identify the truth, even if only with small probability. translated_title: 超越无界信念：偏好和信息在社会学习中的相互作用
translated_abstract: 在社会网络中的连续学习模型中，我们确定了一种称为排他性的学习条件，用于判断社会何时最终学到真理或采取正确的行动。排他性是代理人偏好和信息的共同特征。当需要适用于所有偏好时，它等同于信息具有“无界信念”，这要求任何代理人都可以以小概率单独确定真相。但是对于超过两个状态，无界信念可能是不能持久的：例如，它与单调似然比特性不相容。排他性揭示了对于学习来说至关重要的是，单个代理人必须能够替代任何错误的行动，即使她不能采取正确的行动。我们提出了两类偏好和信息，它们共同满足了排他性条件。
tldr: 本文研究了在社会学习中，偏好和信息如何相互作用。通过排他性条件，我们发现社会在学习中最重要的是一个单个代理人能够替代任何错误的行动，即使不能采取正确的行动。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the interplay of preferences and information in social learning. The main finding is that what is crucial for learning is the ability of a single agent to displace any wrong action, even if it cannot take the correct action.
